description: Conversation where a university admissions office requests an SEO audit of its admissions section, the assistant crawls the site, runs mobile‑friendliness and CTA checks, fetches the backlink profile, and delivers a markdown‑formatted report with prioritized recommendations.

messages.content: You are SEOAuditPro, an AI‑powered SEO auditor. Use the provided tools to crawl websites, run on‑page SEO checks (including mobile friendliness and call‑to‑action clarity), fetch backlink profiles, and generate a markdown‑formatted audit report.
We are the admissions office of XYZ University. Please audit our admissions pages (https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions) focusing on mobile friendliness and clear call‑to‑actions.
Sure, I’ll start by crawling the admissions section to collect all relevant pages.

{"pages":[{"url":"https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions","html":"XYZ University Admissions

Welcome to Admissions

Apply now!

"},{"url":"https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions/undergraduate","html":"Undergraduate Admissions - XYZ University

Undergraduate Programs

"},{"url":"https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions/graduate","html":"Graduate Admissions | XYZ University

Graduate Studies

Start Your Application"}]}

I’ve retrieved the pages. Now I’ll run on‑page SEO checks, paying special attention to mobile friendliness, heading hierarchy, image alt text, and the presence/clarity of call‑to‑action buttons or links.

pages.html: Undergraduate Programs

Graduate Studies

Start Your Application

messages.content: {"issues":[{"url":"https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions","title_missing":false,"meta_description_missing":true,"heading_hierarchy":"OK","mobile_friendly":false,"cta_presence":"Low (no explicit button or link)","suggestions":["Add a concise meta description (<160 characters).","Implement responsive design (viewport meta tag, CSS breakpoints).","Add a clear CTA button like \"Apply Now\" linking to the application page."]},{"url":"https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions/undergraduate","title_missing":false,"meta_description_missing":false,"heading_hierarchy":"OK","mobile_friendly":true,"cta_presence":"High (button present)","suggestions":["Add alt attributes to any images (none detected).","Consider adding structured data for Course schema."]},{"url":"https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions/graduate","title_missing":false,"meta_description_missing":true,"heading_hierarchy":"OK","mobile_friendly":true,"cta_presence":"Medium (text link present)","suggestions":["Add a meta description summarizing graduate admission benefits.","Convert the plain text link to a styled button for better visibility.","Add alt text to any decorative images."]}]}
The on‑page analysis is ready. I’ll now retrieve the backlink profile for xyzuniversity.edu so we can see authority signals and any potential toxic links.
Great, I have both the on‑page issues and the backlink data. I’ll now compile everything into a markdown audit report with priority scores and actionable recommendations.

suggestions: Add a concise meta description (<160 characters).
Implement responsive design (viewport meta tag, CSS breakpoints).
Add a clear CTA button like "Apply Now" linking to the application page.
Add alt attributes to any images (none detected).
Consider adding structured data for Course schema.
Add a meta description summarizing graduate admission benefits.
Convert the plain text link to a styled button for better visibility.
Add alt text to any decorative images.

messages.content:
# SEO Audit Report – XYZ University Admissions

**Site URL:** https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions

---

## Executive Summary

The admissions section is generally well‑structured but suffers from three critical issues:
1. **Mobile usability** – the main admissions landing page is not mobile‑friendly, which can hurt rankings and user experience.
2. **Missing meta descriptions** on two pages, reducing click‑through rates from search results.
3. **Weak call‑to‑action (CTA) presentation** on the main page.

Addressing these items will improve visibility, organic traffic, and conversion rates for prospective students.

---

## Prioritized Recommendations

| Priority | Page | Issue | Recommendation | Impact |
|----------|------|-------|----------------|--------|
| **1** | /admissions | Not mobile‑friendly | Add a responsive viewport meta tag, use CSS break‑points, test via Google Mobile‑Friendly Test. | High (mobile traffic & rankings) |
| **1** | /admissions & /admissions/graduate | Missing meta description | Write concise, keyword‑rich meta descriptions (150‑160 chars). | Medium (CTR boost) |
| **2** | /admissions | No clear CTA | Insert a prominent **"Apply Now"** button linking to the application portal. | High (conversion) |
| **2** | /admissions/graduate | Plain text link | Convert to styled button for better visibility. | Medium |
| **3** | /admissions/undergraduate | No alt text on images | Add descriptive `alt` attributes to all images. | Low |
| **3** | /admissions/undergraduate | No structured data | Implement Course/College schema markup. | Low |

---

## Detailed On‑Page Findings

### https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions
- **Meta Description:** Missing → *Add meta description.*
- **Mobile Friendly:** **Fail** → *Add `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">` and responsive CSS.*
- **CTA:** Low → *Insert a large, primary‑style button linking to `/apply`.*
- **Suggestions:** See Prioritized Recommendations.

### https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions/undergraduate
- **Meta Description:** Present (good).
- **Mobile Friendly:** Pass.
- **CTA:** High (button present).
- **Image Alt Text:** None detected → *Add `alt` attributes.*
- **Structured Data:** None → *Add Course schema.*

### https://xyzuniversity.edu/admissions/graduate
- **Meta Description:** Missing → *Add meta description.*
- **Mobile Friendly:** Pass.
- **CTA:** Medium (text link) → *Style as button.*
- **Image Alt Text:** None detected → *Add `alt` attributes.*

---

## Backlink Profile Overview

| Source URL | Domain Authority | Anchor Text |
|------------|------------------|-------------|
| https://edusources.org/top-universities | 85 | XYZ University |
| https://collegeboard.com/college-search/xyz-university | 78 | XYZ University Admissions |
| https://studentreviewsite.com/reviews/xyz-university | 60 | XYZ University Review |
| https://blog.educationnews.com/2023/09/xyz-university-2024-class | 70 | XYZ University 2024 admissions |

The backlink profile is strong with high‑authority educational domains linking to the university. No toxic links detected.

---

## Next Steps
1. Implement mobile‑friendly changes on the main admissions page.
2. Add meta descriptions to the two pages missing them.
3. Refine CTAs to be more prominent and button‑styled.
4. Review image alt attributes and add structured data where appropriate.
5. Re‑run the audit in 2‑3 weeks to verify improvements.

---

*Report generated by SEOAuditPro.*

✅ The SEO audit is complete! The markdown report above contains an executive summary, priority‑ranked recommendations, detailed on‑page findings for each admissions page, and an overview of your backlink profile. Implement the high‑priority items first (mobile friendliness, meta descriptions, and clear CTAs) and you should see noticeable improvements in search visibility and applicant conversions. Let me know if you’d like help drafting specific meta descriptions or designing the CTA button.
